description: By any measure, the military spending bill on the floor of the House of Representatives is no ordinary piece of legislation.

title: DAY 2 FOR MCFARLANE: TRACING THE TRAIL OF HELP FOR THE CONTRAS
description: In his second day of testimony yesterday at the Congressional hearings in Washington, Robert C. McFarlane faced questions on the National Security Council's involvement with the contras and his understanding of the Boland Amendment. Here, as recorded by The New York Times, are excerpts from his testimony. INOUYE STATEMENT DANIEL K. INOUYE. Before we begin our testimony, I'd like to make the following announcement. We have located the $10 million contributed for the contras by the Sultan of Brunei, which was made in August 1986.

title: STROBER ORGANIZATION reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: Results for 1986 were reported on a pro-forma basis to reflect the company's initial public offering Nov. 7 and the implementation of a compensation plan effective July 1.

title: LIMITED INC reports earnings for Qtr to May 2
Vicorp Rejects Bid
description: Vicorp Restaurants Inc. said its board unanimously rejected an unsolicited bid of $12 a share from M.D.C. Holdings Inc. Vicorp, which has 8.5 million shares outstanding, said the offer was inadaquate. Vicorp stock dropped 37.5 cents today to close at $12.25 a share in over-the-counter trading.

title: U.S., CITING HELP TO NAZIS, ACTS AGAINST A JEWISH MAN
description: The Justice Department moved yesterday to rescind the citizenship of a Polish-born Jewish man who now lives in Brooklyn, on the ground that he brutalized Jewish prisoners at a Nazi concentration camp during World War II.

title: FLORIDA FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN()) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes extraordinary charges of $8,467,000 and $22,678,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively; and the quarter also includes a gain of $17.9 million on sale of mortgage- backed securities. c-Net loss The company said the extraordinary charge of $8,467,000 in the latest quarter includes a prepayment expense of $8 million on Federal Home Loan Bank advances and a $442,000 adjustment to 1984-1985 reversion of pension plan assets.

title: UNICORP CANADA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: Figures are in Canadian funds.

title: New York City Criminal Courts Are More Productive Than Ever
description: To the Editor:

title: OCCIDENTAL NEBRASKA FEDRAL SAVINGS reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
SHELTER PROMOTER IS CHARGED
description: A tax-shelter promoter and several associates were charged yesterday with fraudulently obtaining more than $115 million from investors and cheating the Government of many millions of dollars in false tax deductions.

title: METROPOLITAN DIARY
description: DEAR DIARY:

title: Purcell's 'Dido' in Concert
description: The Central City Chorus will present a concert version of Purcell's ''Dido and Aeneas'' on Sunday at 7 P.M. at Central Presbyterian Church, 593 Park Avenue, at 64th Street. Charles Pilling is to conduct the performance, which will feature Nancy Bergman and Ann Donaldson, sopranos, and William Hanrahan, a baritone. A $7 donation is suggested; information: 838-0808.

title: Cooper Best on Defense
description: Michael Cooper, the 6-foot-6-inch swingman for the Los Angeles Lakers, beat out the National Basketball Association's leader in steals and the top two shot-blockers yesterday in being named the league's outstanding defensive player. Cooper received 26 votes from 78 members of the news media.

title: ENTERTAINMENT PUBLICAIONS reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $666,000 and $1,581,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively; and a loss on disposal of $1,682,000 for both the quarter and 9 months. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $83,000 for the quarter and $98,000 for the 9 months.

title: WAHID RAAFAT
description: Wahid Raafat, one of Egypt's top legal scholars and a senior official of the opposition New Wafd Party, died in his sleep today. He was 81 years old.

title: KN ENERGY INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: The year-ago figures were restated to reflect an accounting change for pension costs.

title: Simpson's Screwballs
description: Back in March, Senator Alan K. Simpson complained about an aggressive press corps that he said was seeking to ''stick it'' in President Reagan's ''gazoo.'' Now the Wyoming Republican offers an opinion about his colleagues on Capitol Hill.

title: U.S. Decides It Won't Send American Envoy Back to Syria
description: The United States has decided not to send Ambassador Thomas Eagleton back to Syria, after withdrawing him last October to protest what the Reagan Admistration said was Syrian backing of international terrorism.

title: Letter From Italian Bishops Adds to Political Fray
description: Italy's Roman Catholic bishops have entered a political debate by issuing a pastoral letter that is widely regarded as an election endorsement of the Christian Democrats.

title: Felker Reported in Talks for Post
description: Clay Felker, who has held editing positions at several New York-based publications over the years, is negotiating to become editor in chief of Manhattan,inc., according to a source close to Mr. Felker. An announcement is expected later this week.

title: TII INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to March 27
description: b-Includes equity in net income of affiliate of $65,000 in the latest quarter and equity in loss of affiliate of $240,000 in the year earlier quarter. c-Includes equity in net income of affiliate of $355,000 in the latest 9 months and equity in net loss of affiliate of $1,524,000 in the year-earlier period.

title: Market Place; Quick Ascent For Microsoft
description: WHEN shares of the Microsoft Corporation took off last week, rising 20 percent, some brokers and traders were skeptical that the stock could hold its gains.

title: WESTBRIDGE CAPITAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes a realized loss on investment of $17,000 for the latest quarter, and for the year-ago period includes a realized gain on investment of $1,181,000.

title: 60-MINUTE GOURMET
description: I AM always amused by the way cooks of different nations can conceive what is ostensibly the same dish yet render it differently. The most famous rice dish in Italy, to choose one example, is risotto, which is creamy, almost saucelike, as opposed to the French interpretation, in which the grains of rice must remain separate or ''stand apart,'' as some cookbooks phrase it.

title: TEMCO HOME HEALTHCARE PRODUCTS reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
'Just a Commando,' Barbie Says of Days in Lyons
description: Making his first defense against charges of crimes against humanity, Klaus Barbie, the wartime Gestapo chief of Lyons, said at his trial today that he was not responsible for the atrocities that took place here during the German occupation.

title: Guokas Reaches Pact
description: Matt Guokas has agreed to a two-year contract to continue coaching the Philadelphia 76ers. The team's owner, Harold Katz, said he did not consider anyone else. The 76ers finished the season second in the Atlantic Division, behind the Boston Celtics, and was eliminated from the playoffs by Milwaukee.

title: New York Premieres At Next Wave Festival
description: New York premieres of works by the directors Peter Brook and Peter Sellars are among the events scheduled for the fifth annual Next Wave Festival at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, festival officials have announced.

title: Going, Going, Gone
description: The glories of 1986 are fading fast for the Mets, whose current concern is to reach the respectability of break-even baseball. Other World Series champions have found rough going the seasons after they dominated. The 10 world championship teams, ranked by games behind, that took the longest falls. M04,10,15,05,10 Year Team Pos. GB 1919 Red Sox 20 1/2 1906 Giants 20 1936 Tigers 19 1/2 1969 Tigers 19 1984 Orioles 19 1955 Giants 18 1/2 1929 Yankees 18 1932 Cardinals 18 1961 Pirates 18 1910 Pirates 17 1/2

title: MAYORS ATTEMPT TO END REVENUE FUND STANDSTILL
description: Mayors from New York's four largest upstate cities came to the State Capitol today to try to resolve a deadlock over revenue sharing funds that has forced the state to miss $38 million in payments to counties, towns and villages since April 25.

title: INSIDE
description: Wedtech Sues Adviser The Wedtech Corporation accused the financial adviser to Attorney General Edwin Meese 3d of conspiring to defraud the company of more than $1 million. Page B1.

title: BEL FUSE INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
REPORT PRAISES MINORITY CONTRACTS PROGRAM
description: More than 70 percent of the companies that participate in the Federal Government's program to foster businesses owned by women and members of minority groups stay in business after leaving the program, according to a report released today by the Senate Committee on Small Business.

title: VISTA RESOURCES INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes pretax gain of $718,423 from the excess of assets in a terminated pension plan over the cost of paid-up annuities covering benefits earned by employees.

title: TEXACO CONFIRMS PAYOUT HALT
description: Shareholders of Texaco Inc. were told officially today that they would not receive dividend payments this quarter, for the first time in the company's 86-year history.

title: Federal Inquiry Of Minoxidil Sales
description: The International Trade Commission said it would investigate complaints by the Upjohn Company that its controversial minoxidil baldness treatment was being illegally duplicated and sold in the United States.

title: BUFFETS INC reports earnings for 16wks to April 22
description: Share earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split to be paid May 18.

title: Iowa Mayor in Knife Mishap
description: Mayor Donald Canney was accidentally stabbed over the weekend when a knife for filleting fish dropped, bounced off a workbench and struck him in the abdomen, officials said. Mr. Canney, 57 years old, was reported in fair condition Monday in Mercy Hospital's intensive care unit. A hospital spokesman said the injury was not life-threatening.

title: CHEFS' DEBATE: INNOVATION VS. CLASSIC FRENCH FOOD
description: A CULINARY generation gap? Yes. In this country, members of the old guard, producing classic French cuisine, vie for customers with members of the new guard, American chefs producing an often idiosyncratic cuisine. What, if anything, do these Americans owe to their classic French forebears? Which cooking style holds the greater allure for restaurant-goers?

title: PATH CLEARED FOR THE RETURN OF L.I.'S TRASH
description: After 51 days and 5,000 miles at sea, the pariah garbage barge Mobro can come home again - but it probably won't.

title: COMMODITY OUTLOOK: NO BIG PRICE RISES SEEN
description: By all the laws of supply and demand, commodity prices should not have jumped sharply this week. That they did, despite the worldwide glut of most materials, underscores the extent to which prices are responding to speculation and to the fear that the American economy is suffering once again from inflation.

title: PETROLEUM EQUIPMENT TOOLS CO reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Robert Doud, Leader in Ban Of Cars on Mackinac Island
description: Robert Doud, who helped organize a ban on motor vehicles on this island between Michigan's peninsulas, died Monday. He was 85 years old.

title: MEM CO INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
GUARANTEE FINANCIAL CORP OF CALIFORNIA reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net loss The company, in the year-ago first quarter, adjusted earnings to reflect the marking to market of its March 31, 1986, position in financial options on U.S. Treasury securities.

title: Cocaine Use Denied
description: Johnny High, a former guard with the Phoenix Suns, has denied that he told local authorities he shared cocaine with a former teammate, Dennis Johnson. In Maricopa County grand jury transcripts published last week in The Mesa (Ariz.) Tribune, High, 30 years old, was quoted as saying that he used cocaine with Johnson, now a member of the Boston Celtics, three times in the 1982-83 season when both played for the Suns.

title: When Klaus Barbie Worked for the U.S. Army; Open the U.N. Files
description: To the Editor:

title: PAINSTAKING BIOLOGISTS SEEK TRUMPETER SWAN RENAISSANCE IN MICHIGAN
description: Biologists in Kalamazoo are going to great lengths these days to bring back the trumpeter swan, a native bird that has not been seen in Michigan this century.

title: Brewers Lose 7th in Row, 10-8
description: Terry Steinbach, a rookie, drove in four runs and Mike Davis hit a two-run homer to cap a five-run sixth inning as the Oakland Athletics sent the Milwaukee to their seventh straight loss, 10-8.

title: COMPUTER FACTORY INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: Share earnings and shares outstanding reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid in March.

title: Real Estate; Low-Cost Space for Artists
description: GUIDEBOOKS for tourists still uphold the notion that Greenwich Village and SoHo are full of painters and sculptors, but most artists looking for low-cost studio space in Manhattan today have as much chance of finding it in those areas as getting a debut showing at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Guinness-Distillers Suit
description: A New York State Supreme Court justice reserved decision yesterday on a motion to order Meshulam Riklis, head of Schenley Industries Inc., to answer questions about his involvement in the British takeover battle between Guinness P.L.C. and the Distillers Company.

title: CHICKEN INSPECTION IS FAULTED
description: The Government's program for inspecting chickens is inadequate to protect the public against such dangerous disease organisms as salmonella and campylobacter, a panel of scientists said today.

title: Nation Is Demeaned by Press Prying on Hart
description: To the Editor:

title: EPITOPE reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
HALSEY DRUG CO reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Marcal Paper Mills Consolidates at Fisher
description: Marcal Paper Mills has consolidated all of its advertising at Fisher Jackson Levy Flaxman, which means assigning the agency an additional $2 million in billings for its paper products. The former agency was Earle Palmer Brown in Philadelphia.

title: 'ELEPHANT ON HILL,' ART AND TECHNOLOGY
description: HOW do art and technology coexist? Is it possible they are one and the same?

title: WEDTECH, ALLEGING FRAUD, SUES AN ADVISER TO MEESE
description: The Wedtech Corporation yesterday accused a financial adviser to Attorney General Edwin Meese 3d of conspiring to defraud the company of more than $1 million.

title: 2 Ex-U.S. Aides Talk to Walsh's Investigators
description: Two former White House officials involved in the Iran-contra affair have begun cooperating with the investigation by a special prosecutor, according to Federal investigators and people with knowledge of their accounts.

title: PETROMINERALS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes a writedown of oil and gas properties of $4,752,000 net of taxes.

title: Combination Unit Steams, Roasts, Bakes
description: ANDRE SOLTNER, proprietor and chef of Lutece, recalled how his assistants balked at the idea of installing a new type of oven in the kitchen of the world-famous restaurant. ''They told me I was crazy and that they did not want to use the oven,'' Mr. Soltner said. ''I now have to fight to get to it.''

title: SOUND ADVICE reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
CANADIENS AVOID ELIMINATION
description: Ron Hextall, the Flyers' rookie goalie extraordinaire, at long last proved porous. By the third period, Mike Keenan, the autocratic Flyers' coach, appeared resigned to a Montreal revival and a show of inspiration that forced this series back to the Forum for a sixth game Thursday. He blamed the loss on the officials who called, according to him, too erratic a game.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: WEDNESDAY, MAY 13, 1987
description: Companies

title: Grain and Soybeans Off, But Metals Keep Rising
description: Prices of grain and soybean futures fell back yesterday, partly because the Government decided to sell more beans from its inventory and partly because it is reportedly balking at paying higher subsidies on wheat ordered by the Soviet Union.

title: MEDSTAT SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After tax credits of $138,000 for the quarter and $260,000 for the 6 months. c-After tax credits of $28,000 for the quarter and $60,000 for the 6 months.

title: GEONEX CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Grave Thoughts
description: The Indianapolis 500 is such a prestigious event for Indiana's capital city that ''everyone in the area wants to get into the swing of things, to have some connection with the race,'' according to Robert Stone, the special services director for the Chamber of Commerce's Citizens' Speedway Committee.

title: Eurotunnel Railroad Deal
description: Eurotunnel, the British-French consortium formed to dig a tunnel linking Britain and continental Europe, settled a financial dispute today with railroads in Britain and France.

title: No Word From Hearns
description: Thomas Hearns failed to respond to a purse bid to fight the No. 2 contender, Michael Olajide, for the vacant International Boxing Federation world middleweight championship, ending chances for the fight, the federation said yesterday. Its president, Robert W. Lee, said Hearns, the No. 1 contender, did not notify the I.B.F. of his intentions within 24 hours of Monday's $1.2 million bid by Frank Warren of England. Olajide's response was positive, the boxing federation said. Lee said the I.B.F. would now notify the next six contenders in order to determine whether any would be interested in fighting Olajide.

title: EECP INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 29
description: b-Net income Share earnings and shares outstanding for 1986 are adjusted to reflect the 3-for-2 stock split in August 1986.

title: Payton an Owner?
description: Walter Payton, the star running back of the Chicago Bears, said yesterday he would meet with Commissioner Pete Rozelle to explore the possibility of becoming the principal owner of a National Football League expansion franchise.

title: Romancing the Indian Museum
description: Barely three months after H. Ross Perot, the computer magnate, withdrew his $70 million bid to buy the Museum of the American Indian for Texas, a new suitor with even deeper pockets has appeared. The Smithsonian Institution, encouraged by Senator Daniel Inouye of Hawaii, dangles before museum trustees the vision of a home on the Washington Mall and a nearby research facility, costing $100 million, and the security of affiliation with the Federal Government. ''In a city of monuments, it is inconceivable there should not be a suitable one for American Indians,'' says Senator Inouye.

title: DEVON GROUP reports earnings for Year to March 31
description: b-Includes income from discontinued operations of $88,000, or 1 cent a share, for the latest quarter and $421,000, or 5 cents a share, for the year-earlier period.

title: NOBLE DRILLING reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
U.S. PLANS TO RETURN $450 MILLION TO IRAN FROM FROZEN ASSETS
description: The United States will return more than $450 million in frozen assets to Iran to comply with a ruling by an American-Iranian tribunal at The Hague, the State Department said today.

title: BOLAND AND CONTRAS: CURBS THAT VARY
description: The Congressional amendments restricting aid to the Nicaraguan rebels are written in language that is unadorned and clear, as their author said last week, but with implications that are ambiguous and confusing.

title: WATER FROM SEA: A CHEAPER WAY
description: RESEARCHERS here have developed a new process that can extract fresh drinking water from sea water at a significantly lower cost than can existing desalination systems.

title: TELEPROBE SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to March 27
description: b-Includes tax credits of $36,400 and $179,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Net loss After preferred stock dividends in the latest quarter, earnings per share were less than one cent. Latest quarter and 9-month sales include $253,000 in accrued liquidation damages for purchase order shortfalls resulting from AT&T's failure to purchase sufficient products in the periods in accordance with minimum requirements under its agrewement with the company.

title: PLAN TO MOVE INDIAN MUSEUM IS UNDER ATTACK
description: Some members of Congress from New York expressed concern today as it appeared that the Museum of the American Indian was nearing an agreement that would bring it to Washington as a part of the Smithsonian Institution.

title: EDUCATIONAL COMPUTER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
RECTIFYING AN OLD MISTAKE
description: The principle that a husband could not be prosecuted for raping his wife was based on a mistaken belief that this idea was part of English common law, the New Jersey Supreme Court said in 1981.

title: FOOD NOTES
description: PRESERVES MADE EASIER Home cooks who make preserves, jams and jellies often do not want to bother with placing the finished product in a boiling water bath. Instead, they just tighten the lids and store the jars in the pantry, although doing so can foster the growth of dangerous organisms.

title: THATCHER'S GOAL: A CHANGED BRITAIN
description: Margaret Thatcher is seeking much more than the record for longevity she will have within her grasp if she leads her party to its third straight election victory June 11. She is really running for a place on that short list of Prime Ministers who have profoundly altered this change-resistant nation.

title: FULL SPEED AHEAD, PLEASE
description: After a tedious session today that produced little signficant new information, the leaders of the Congressional investigative committees met and established new procedures to speed up the proceedings in the weeks ahead.

title: Trade Surplus In Canada Cut
description: Canada's merchandise trade surplus was sliced by a quarter in March, as imports grew for the second consecutive month and exports fell, Statistics Canada said today.

title: WINE TALK
description: LIKE free-run wine, which pours from fermentation tanks, leaving skins and seeds behind, wine books are flowing from printing presses at such a rate that wine enthusiasts can barely keep pace.

title: Regional-Theater Plays In New York Festival
description: Four plays from regional theaters in Connecticut, Pennsylvania and California are to be given their New York debuts during the Joyce Theater Foundation's 1987 American Theater Exchange, which begins next month.

title: Bond Prices Swing Upward
description: Bond prices rose yesterday in response to stability in the dollar and a drop in commodities prices.

title: DISCOVERING THE LILY'S PIQUANT RELATIVES
description: LEAD: THE splashy, sumptuous tiger and Turk's-cap lilies trumpet the warm-weather season. And they bring to mind the special gastronomic lilies - the leeks, elephant garlic, giant shallots and baby leeks - that now appear with more frequency in local markets and at greengrocers.

title: 2 CHEESES ARE RECALLED
description: Two cheese products are being recalled in 25 states following the discovery in North Carolina of bacteria contamination in one of them. The manufacturer, Fromageries Bel Inc., said Monday that it was voluntarily recalling 657 cases of Mini Bonbel (expiration date July 23, 1987), and Mini Gouda (expiration dates July 23 and July 24, 1987).

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A listing yesterday of Tony Award nominations for best choreography misidentified some. The four nominees are Ron Field (''Rags''), Gillian Gregory (''Me and My Girl''), Brian Macdonald (''The Mikado'') and Arlene Phillips (''Starlight Express'').

title: BAKER SEES TRADE GAP SHRINKAGE
description: Treasury Secretary James A. Baker 3d said today that he could see ''good evidence'' that trade imbalances were starting to ease. Coincidentally, West Germany ordered a reduction in a key interest rate - a move of the kind that Mr. Baker has been urging to help the lagging world economy.

title: SLATTERY GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes income from discontinued opeations of $102,000. c-Net loss and includes income from discontinued operations of $72,000.

title: FORTUNE SYSTEMS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net income and includes a tax credit of $164,000.

title: VOTERS TURN ASIDE BLACK RIGHTS PLAN
description: Voters today narrowly endorsed a new system of city government that had been opposed by the black victors in a voting-rights lawsuit that led to the nonbinding referendum.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: The Market Profile chart in Business Day yesterday misstated the daily percentage changes for three stock indexes. The N.Y.S.E. index was down 0.477 percent, the Standard & Poors composite index was down 0.614 percent and the Dow Jones industrial average was down 0.646 percent.

title: RECORD AUCTION PRICE FOR SCULPTURE
description: Alberto Giacometti's ''Large Female Standing II,'' from 1960, was sold last night from Baron Lambert's collection at Christie's for $3.63 million, the highest price ever paid at auction for a sculpture and for a work by the artist.

title: Trade Interpretations
description: Determined to reverse America's soaring trade deficit and to get tough with countries that close their markets to American goods, Congress has moved swiftly this session to pull together major trade legislation. The House of Representatives has already passed an omnibus trade bill, and the Senate is scheduled to vote on its version early next month.

title: FILM STARS PROTEST COLORING
description: Woody Allen made one of his rare forays outside of Manhattan today to testify before a Congressional panel on what he called the ''sinful'' practice of coloring classic old black-and-white movies such as ''Casablanca'' and ''It's a Wonderful Life,'' and new black-and-white ones like his own ''Manhattan'' and ''Broadway Danny Rose.''

title: High Official Quits At Bankers Trust
description: David O. Beim, a managing director and one of the highest-ranking officers of the Bankers Trust Company, has resigned to seek a job in what he called a ''traditional'' investment bank.

title: CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA FINANCIAL reports earnings for Year to March 31
FIRSTCORP INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $245,000 for both the quarter and year.

title: Why Do We Still Have Saturday Mail Delivery?
description: To the Editor:

title: VALID LOGIC SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes charges of $12,715,000 relating to the company's acquisition of Telesis Systems Corp. c-Net income

title: Edelman May Raise Bid for Burlington
description: The New York investor Asher B. Edelman, growing impatient with what he called a ''coercive and unfair'' counteroffer by Burlington Industries, said yesterday that he might raise his $67-a-share bid for the textile giant.

title: SBARRO INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
MODERN CONTROLS INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
22 Jets for Norway Line
description: Braathen SAFE, a Norwegian airline, said today that it would order 22 medium-sized jet aircraft from either the Boeing Company or the McDonnell Douglas Corporation next week. Industry experts estimated the deal would be worth some $600 million. The airline, privately owned and founded by the Braathen shipping family of Oslo, is the second-biggest airline flying in Norway after the Scandinavian Airline System.

title: DELAY IN FIRST INSIDER TRIAL IS BARRED
description: A Federal judge rejected a request yesterday by Government prosecutors for a two-month delay in the insider-trading trial of three senior Wall Street figures.

title: REAGAN DENIES ASKING SAUDIS FOR CONTRA AID
description: President Reagan said today that he did not solicit money for the Nicaraguan rebels in private meetings with King Fahd of Saudi Arabia in 1985.

title: Stories of the City; The Art of Being Telephone Hip: Wait for the Beep
description: Alice McCarver knew there was no chance at reconciliation with her husband when she left home for what she thought was a weekend trial separation and called her apartment -only to find the tape on the answering machine had been changed to the first person singular.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: FAME AND MISFORTUNE Tradition has it that in the world of theater the show must go on. And adhering to this concept, students of Fiorella H. La Guardia High School of Music and the Arts are staging their annual major production - ''Jesus Christ, Superstar,'' this year - in the school's four-story lobby. La Guardia comprises two high schools that were physically separated before the fall of 1980, Music and Art High School and the High School of Performing Arts. Performing Arts is now often identified with the movie ''Fame,'' and among its alumni are Liza Minelli, Diahann Carroll, Billy Dee Williams, Catherine Malfitano and Julia Migenes-Johnson.

title: A CITY HOSPITAL LOSES JUDGEMENT OF $28 MILLION
description: A State Supreme Court jury in the Bronx yesterday awarded nearly $28 million to a Bronx man who entered a city-run hospital with a broken leg and suffered severe brain damage after being administered anesthesia.

title: LEGG MASON INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
SPORTO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
STUDENTS FAULTED ON GLOBAL ISSUES
description: America's schoolchildren are ''globally illiterate,'' lacking a knowledge of the culture, history and geography of other nations, according to a report made public yesterday.

title: DREXLER TECHNOLOGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to March 27
description: b-After a tax credit of $1,325,000.

title: FLORIDA EMPLOYERS INSURNCE reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Bridge: More Than 100,000 Players Expected for Epson Contest
description: The world's biggest competitive event of any kind, the Epson Worldwide Bridge Contest, will be played Saturday at 2 P.M. on the East Coast. The number of players around the world, competing about the same time, is expected to reach six figures.

title: WEATHERFORD INTERNAIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes a loss from discontinued operations of $449,000.

title: The U.N. Today: May 13, 1987
description: ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL Social Committee - 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: GANDER MOUNTAIN INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After a tax credit of $270,000. The company went public in April 1986.

title: Brains and Brawn Blended to Win
description: For a three-school athletic venture that prides itself on its academic excellence, Claremont-Mudd-Scripps in California has been doing suspiciously well on the playing field. With 17 varsity sports, including 7 women's teams, C.M.S., a member of the seven-team Southern California Intercollegiate Athletic Conference, spent the academic year as the reigning conference champion in eight of them - men's football, basketball, baseball, soccer, tennis, water polo and swimming, and women's cross-country.

title: Addendum
description: * Raben Publishing has acquired Home Gym and Fitness magazine.

title: Wanted: A Leader
description: The impending merger of the country's two biggest groups opposing nuclear arms, the Committee for a Sane Nuclear Policy and the Nuclear Weapons Freeze Campaign, has set off a search for a high-profile president, somebody who could command a salary as high as $100,000 a year, according to the capital's rumor mill.

title: NRM ENERGY CO reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net income Results for 1986 are restated to reflect a change in accounting methods from full-cost to successful-efforts.

title: OVERSEAS SHIPHOLDING GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes gains from the disposal of vessels, including in 1986 the value of related unexpired charters, amounting to $668,000, or 3 cents a share, in the latest quarter and $2,604,000, or 10 cents a share, in the year-earlier quarter.

title: Oil Industry Analyst Kills Himself in Hotel
description: An oil industry analyst for the Standard & Poor's Corporation was found shot to death in his room at the Sheraton City Squire Hotel yesterday afternoon, apparently a suicide, the police said.

title: BOEING GETS BIG STAKE IN ALLEGIS
description: United Airlines announced yesterday a $2.1 billion airplane deal aimed at protecting the carrier and its parent company, the Allegis Corporation, from a hostile takeover.

title: FLOW GENERAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After tax credits of $37,000 and $77,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Net income

title: PHOENIX AMERICAN INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Dow Up 15.30 in Nervous Trading
description: The Dow Jones industrial average moved higher yesterday, as the overall market was mixed in nervous trading.

title: Economic Scene; Responding To Gorbachev
description: DOES the drive of General Secretary Mikhail S. Gorbachev to ''reconstruct'' the Soviet economy and society provide an opportunity for the United States to strengthen its own economy and stabilize the international system, of which it is the leader?

title: FLORIDA BILLS TO EASE CURBS ON CONCEALED FIREARMS
description: The State Senate today passed and sent to Gov. Bob Martinez two bills that would remove local control over who may carry concealed guns.

title: BILL ON ETHICS WOULD LIMIT CONTRIBUTIONS
description: In a move that could profoundly change the way political campaigns in New York City are financed, lawmakers in both houses of the State Legislature introduced a bill today that would significantly reduce the maximum contribution individuals can make to candidates for city offices.

title: Mets' Harmony Restored
description: A little bit of harmony was restored to the Mets this morning when Manager Dave Johnson and General Manager Frank Cashen met and discussed the Roger McDowell situation.

title: 'We'd Like You to Stand Up'
description: When the ex-football player appeared on the set, a bystander said, ''What a handsome guy.'' And now the ex-football player, in a gray suit with a blue shirt, a burgundy tie and shiny new black wing-tip shoes, was under the big lights in the Boken sound studio in Greenwich Village where the television spot was about to be taped.

title: MR ROOTER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net income

title: Nautilus to Go to Dallas
description: Nautilus Sports-Medical Industries said it was moving its headquarters from Lake Helen, Fla., to Dallas. Nautilus, a leading manufacturer of exercise equipment, is a subsidiary of Dallas-based Ward International. Its president, Stephen L. Thompson, said Dallas had been selected because of its business-oriented attitude, available buildings and housing market.

title: PERES CALLS OPPOSITION 'ARROGANT'
description: Prime Minister Yitzhak Shamir attacked Foreign Minister Shimon Peres's proposal for an international Middle East peace conference today, describing it as a ''perverse and criminal'' idea that must be ''wiped off'' the Cabinet table.

title: PROSECUTORS CRITICIZED AS DEFENSE CONCLUDES IN DONOVAN CASE
description: With his relatives looking on, State Senator Joseph L. Galiber heard his chief lawyer urge a jury yesterday to acquit Mr. Galiber of conspiring with former Labor Secretary Raymond J. Donovan and others to steal $7.4 million on a New York City subway project.

title: U.S. PETROLEUM DATA
description: In millions of barrels except refinery utilization

title: LEGAL LIFE JACKET FOR MR. MEESE
description: It's no longer remarkable to find the U.S. Attorney General under investigation by a special prosecutor. The case of the Wedtech Corporation marks the third time that an independent counsel, appointed by a court under the Ethics in Government Act, has scrutinized Edwin Meese's conduct -twice at his own request. What is remarkable is that Mr. Meese continues to denounce as unconstitutional the law that makes such inquiries possible.

title: CONTROL LASER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net loss

title: AOI COAL reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net loss

title: GANHDI BOLSTERS FORCES IN PUNJAB
description: Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi sent at least 5,000 more paramilitary policemen to the Punjab today as his Government assumed direct command of the campaign to curb terrorist attacks by Sikh extremists in the northern state.

title: U.S. to Appeal G.M. Decision
description: The Federal Government said Monday that it would appeal a Federal judge's decision against requiring the recall of 1.1 million 1980 General Motors automobiles because of allegations of braking problems.

title: SULZBERGER IS ELECTED CHAIRMAN OF MET
description: Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, chairman and chief executive officer of The New York Times Company and publisher of The New York Times, was elected chairman of the Metropolitan Museum of Art yesterday by unanimous vote of the board of trustees. He succeeds J. Richardson Dilworth, the chairman since 1983, who resigned last month because of illness.

title: MORLAN INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
COMEDY: MIKE FEDER
description: MIKE FEDER, who expounds on urban life each Sunday morning on WBAI-FM to a loyal following, has made the transition from radio personality to stage performer with smoothness and grace.

STOCKHOLDER SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
PENTA SYSTEMS INTERNAIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
